intro: Trichotosia thomsenii, commonly known as the Thomas's trichotosia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
